areas.name: Capacity
areas.description: This area describes the ability of a MS to prevent, detect, and analyse cyber threats and incidents.

subareas.description: Availability of measures to increase specialised cybersecurity skills and knowledge.

subareas.name: Cyber hygiene
subareas.description: Implementation of measures for cyber-hygiene.

subareas.name: Cybersecurity awareness and education
subareas.description: Societal knowledge of cybersecurity and efforts to increase cybersecuirty awareness.

areas.name: Market/Industry
areas.description: This area describes the ability of the private sector to prevent, detect, and analyse cyber threats and incidents.

subareas.name: Cybersecurity investments and innovation
subareas.description: Extent to which enterprises invest into their current and future security.

subareas.name: Cybersecurity governance within organisations
subareas.description: Extent to which enterprises implement policy and measures to prevent cyber incidents.

subareas.name: Impact of cybersecurity incidents
subareas.description: Extent to which enterpises have suffered from cybersecurity incidents.

subareas.name: Impact of cybersecurity incidents (SMEs)
subareas.description: Extent to which SMEs have suffered from cybersecurity incidents.

areas.name: Operations
areas.description: This area describes the ability of a state to carry out operations to ensure resilience.

subareas.name: National-level response preparedness
subareas.description: Extent to which a country is prepared to deal with cyber-related issues.

subareas.name: Operational capabilities
subareas.description: Development of joint capabilities.

subareas.name: Operational cooperation
subareas.description: Definition of a framework for cooperation at the national level.

subareas.name: National-level threat and vulnerability management
subareas.description: National effors for threat and vulnerability management.

subareas.name: Resilience of key operators
subareas.description: Resilience of key operators in terms of  incidents and their duration.

areas.name: Policy
areas.description: This area describes the state of policy development and implementation.

subareas.name: National-level risk management
subareas.description: Coverage of risk-management at the national level.

subareas.name: International cooperation
subareas.description: Alignement with international practices and policies.

subareas.name: Coverage and enforcement of legal and regulatory framework
subareas.description: Existence and coverage of national legislations.

subareas.name: Policies for knowledge and skills
subareas.description: Definition of a policy framework for the development of knowledge and skills.

domains_of_excellence.subareaDescription: National effors for threat and vulnerability management.
domains_of_excellence.algorithm:
average (normalised by number of IPs in a country) of:
- SSL - Number of IPs using only modern TLS protocols without potential vulnerabilities, self-signed or expired certificates
- IPv6 - Number of IPs version6 without old SSL/TLS protocols, potential vulnerabilities, self-signed or expired certificates
- Banner - Number of websites with banners publishing <U+201C>Content-Security Policy<U+201D> without old SSL/TLS protocols, potential vulnerabilities, self-signed or expired certificates

Weighted value of 8 Eurostat variables =
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises using strong password authentication (E_SECMSPSW)
<U+2022>	ICT security measure used: combination of at least two authentication mechanisms (e.g. user-defined password, one-time password (OTP), code generated via a security token or received via a smartphone, biometric methods) (E_SECMDUO)
<U+2022>	Share  of enterprises using encryption techniques for data, documents or e-mails (E_SECMDENC)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises using data backup to a separate location (including backup to the cloud) (E_SECMOSBU)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises using network access control (management of access by devices and users to the enterprise's network) (E_SECMNAC)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises using VPN (Virtual Private Network extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network) (E_SECMVPN)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises maintaining log files for analysis after security incidents (E_SECMLOG)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises performing ICT security tests (E_SECMTST)
Weight = 1/8 per variable

Weighted value of 8 Eurostat variables for SMEs =
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using strong password authentication (E_SECMSPSW)
<U+2022>  ICT security measure used: combination of at least two authentication mechanisms (e.g. user-defined password, one-time password (OTP), code generated via a security token or received via a smartphone, biometric methods) (E_SECMDUO)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using encryption techniques for data, documents or e-mails (E_SECMDENC)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using data backup to a separate location (including backup to the cloud) (E_SECMOSBU)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using network access control (management of access by devices and users to the enterprise's network) (E_SECMNAC)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using VPN (Virtual Private Network extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network) (E_SECMVPN)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises maintaining log files for analysis after security incidents (E_SECMLOG)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises performing ICT security tests (E_SECMTST)
Weight = 1/8 per variable

domains_of_excellence.subareaDescription: Extent to which enterprises invest into their current and future security.
domains_of_excellence.indicator: Share of enterprises that buy security software applications as Cloud Computing Service
domains_of_excellence.algorithm:
Share of enterprises that buy security software applications (as a CC service)
(Eurostat value for the variable E_CC_PSEC "Enterprises that buy security software applications (as a CC service))

domains_of_excellence.subareaDescription: Extent to which enterprises invest into their current and future security.
domains_of_excellence.indicator: Share of enterprises that use AI technologies for ICT security
domains_of_excellence.algorithm:
Share of enterprises using AI technologies for ICT security
(Eurostat value for the variable E_AI_PITS "Enterprises use of AI technologies for ICT security")

domains_of_improvement.subareaName: Coverage and enforcement of legal and regulatory framework
domains_of_improvement.subareaDescription: Existence and coverage of national legislations.
domains_of_improvement.algorithm: Score (%) =   SUM ( Score Qx )  / Maximum total score (30)

domains_of_improvement.subareaDescription: Resilience of key operators in terms of  incidents and their duration.
domains_of_improvement.algorithm:
e-communication resilience (year X) based on serious outage times = 
            RANK (SUM(outage times) /1 M citizens by country); high to low) / #EU MS

domains_of_improvement.subareaDescription: Extent to which enterprises invest into their current and future security.
domains_of_improvement.indicator: Cybersecurity Investments by surveyed essential/important entities as part of their overall IT Budget/Spending
domains_of_improvement.algorithm: NIS investment study value for average share of information security budget spending by surveyed essential/important entities as part of their overall IT budget/spending

domains_of_improvement.subareaDescription: Coverage of risk-management at the national level.
domains_of_improvement.indicator: Definition and compliance of cybersecurity baseline(s) for essential and important entities
domains_of_improvement.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx*) / Maximum total score (10)

*Q1 based on ES-IMC, A-PC-OE3-02 - Cyber resilience requirements

domains_of_improvement.subareaDescription: Alignement with international practices and policies.
domains_of_improvement.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (23)

*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 17 "Engage in international cooperation (not only with EU MS)"

areas.name: Capacity
areas.description: This area describes the ability of a MS to prevent, detect, and analyse cyber threats and incidents.

subareas.name: Cyber hygiene
subareas.description: Implementation of measures for cyber-hygiene.

indicators.indicator: Enterprises: ICT security measures
indicators.algorithm:
Weighted value of 8 Eurostat variables =
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises using strong password authentication (E_SECMSPSW)
<U+2022>	ICT security measure used: combination of at least two authentication mechanisms (e.g. user-defined password, one-time password (OTP), code generated via a security token or received via a smartphone, biometric methods) (E_SECMDUO)
<U+2022>	Share  of enterprises using encryption techniques for data, documents or e-mails (E_SECMDENC)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises using data backup to a separate location (including backup to the cloud) (E_SECMOSBU)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises using network access control (management of access by devices and users to the enterprise's network) (E_SECMNAC)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises using VPN (Virtual Private Network extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network) (E_SECMVPN)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises maintaining log files for analysis after security incidents (E_SECMLOG)
<U+2022>	Share of enterprises performing ICT security tests (E_SECMTST)
Weight = 1/8 per variable

indicators.indicator: SMEs: ICT security measures
indicators.algorithm:
Weighted value of 8 Eurostat variables for SMEs =
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using strong password authentication (E_SECMSPSW)
<U+2022>  ICT security measure used: combination of at least two authentication mechanisms (e.g. user-defined password, one-time password (OTP), code generated via a security token or received via a smartphone, biometric methods) (E_SECMDUO)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using encryption techniques for data, documents or e-mails (E_SECMDENC)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using data backup to a separate location (including backup to the cloud) (E_SECMOSBU)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using network access control (management of access by devices and users to the enterprise's network) (E_SECMNAC)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises using VPN (Virtual Private Network extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network) (E_SECMVPN)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises maintaining log files for analysis after security incidents (E_SECMLOG)
<U+2022>  Share of enterprises performing ICT security tests (E_SECMTST)
Weight = 1/8 per variable

indicators.indicator: Privacy and protection of personal data: citizens<U+00A0>
indicators.algorithm:
Share of individuals that managed access to personal data on the internet by performing at least one of the following actions: 

<U+2022> read privacy policy statements before providing personal data
<U+2022> restricted or refused access to the geographical location
<U+2022> limited access to profile or content on social networking sites or shared online storage
<U+2022> refused allowing the use of personal data for advertising purposes
<U+2022> checked that the website where personal data provided was secure

(Eurostat value for variable I_MAPS_5 corresponding to the % of individuals that manage access to personal data on the internet (3 months) by performing at least one of the following actions: I_MAPS_RPS, I_MAPS_RRGL, I_MAPS_LAP, I_MAPS_RAAD, I_MAPS_CWSC)

indicators.indicator: Secure internet use by citizens
indicators.algorithm: Share of Internet users who changed the way they use the internet due to security concerns

subareas.name: Cybersecurity awareness and education
subareas.description: Societal knowledge of cybersecurity and efforts to increase cybersecuirty awareness.

indicators.indicator: Enterprises: Staff Awareness
indicators.algorithm:
Share of of enterprises make persons employed aware of their obligations in ICT security related issues
(Eurostat value for variable E_SECAWANY "Enterprises make persons employed aware of their obligations in ICT security related issues")

indicators.indicator: Knowledge of cybersecurity matters by citizens
indicators.algorithm:
Weighted values of 2 Eurobarometer variables =  
<U+2022>	Share of internet users who feel very-well/well informed about the risks of cybercrime 
<U+2022>	Share of internet users who are aware of the existence of a website, email address, online form, or contact number in their country where they can report a cybercrime or any other illegal online behaviour (e.g. cyberattack, online harassment or bullying)
Weight: 1/2 for each variable

indicators.indicator: SMEs: Awareness training
indicators.algorithm:
Weighted values of 3 Eurobarometer variables = 
<U+2022>	Share of SMEs that provided their employees with training or awareness raising about the risks of cybercrime in the last 12 months 
<U+2022>	Share  of SMEs whose management feels that they are very well/well informed about the risks of cybercrime 
<U+2022>	Share of SMEs whose employees feel that they are very well/well informed about the risks of cybercrime
Weight = 1/3 per variable

indicators.indicator: SMEs: Staff Awareness
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises that make persons employed aware of their obligations in ICT security related issues
(Eurostat value for variable E_SECAWANY " Enterprises make persons employed aware of their obligations in ICT security related issues")

indicators.indicator: Cybersecurity (curricula) graduates in higher education
indicators.algorithm:
Cybersecurity graduates in higher education = 
       Count of cybersecurity graduates in higher education curricula / per 10K Population in a country %

subareas.name: Cybersecurity knowledge and skills
subareas.description: Availability of measures to increase specialised cybersecurity skills and knowledge.

indicators.indicator: National level cybersecurity trainings
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (24)

*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 7 "Strenghten training and educational programmes"

indicators.indicator: Tools and training to fight cybercrime
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (35)

*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 12 "Address cybercrime"

indicators.indicator: Cybersecurity exercises at national and international level
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (40)

*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 6 "Organise cybersecurity exercises"

indicators.indicator: Country share of EU R&D funding
indicators.algorithm: Share of EU R&D funding awarded per country for cybersecurity topics = EU Contribution for Horizon Europe calls related to cybersecurity in year n/EU contribution for HORIZON EUROPE calls per country in year n per 10 units %

areas.name: Market/Industry
areas.description: This area describes the ability of the private sector to prevent, detect, and analyse cyber threats and incidents.

subareas.name: Cybersecurity governance within organisations
subareas.description: Extent to which enterprises implement policy and measures to prevent cyber incidents.

indicators.indicator: Share of enterprises performing a risk assessment
indicators.algorithm:
Share  of  enterprises performing a cybersecurity risk assessment
(Eurostat value for varialble E_SECMRASS "percentage of  enterprises performing a cybersecurity risk assessment)

indicators.indicator: Enterprises: ICT security policy
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises that have document(s) on measures, practices or procedures on ICT security
(Eurostat value for the variable E_SECPOL2 "percentage of enterprises that have document(s) on measures, practices or procedures on ICT security")

indicators.indicator: Number of organisations/enterprises certified with relevant ISO standards (ISO 22301:2019 - Business Continuity Management; ISO 28001:2007 - Security management systems for the supply chain; ISO/IEC 27001:2013)
indicators.algorithm:
Indicator = average percentage of organisations with any of the three ISO certificates. ( (metric 1 + metric 2 + metric 3)/3 ) %
metric 1 = (Number of sites per country certified for ISO 22301:2019 / number of enterprises per country per 1K ) 
metric 2 = (Number of sites per country certified for ISO 27001:2013 / number of enterprises per country per 1K )
metric 3 = (Number of sites per country certified for ISO 28000:2007 / number of enterprises per country per 1K )

indicators.indicator: Supply chain management by essential and important entities
indicators.algorithm: Average share per country of NIS investment study value for  surveyed essential/important entities  with third -party risk management policies

subareas.name: Cybersecurity investments and innovation
subareas.description: Extent to which enterprises invest into their current and future security.

indicators.indicator: Cybersecurity Investments by surveyed essential/important entities as part of their overall IT Budget/Spending
indicators.algorithm: NIS investment study value for average share of information security budget spending by surveyed essential/important entities as part of their overall IT budget/spending

indicators.indicator: Share of enterprises that buy security software applications as Cloud Computing Service
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises that buy security software applications (as a CC service)
(Eurostat value for the variable E_CC_PSEC "Enterprises that buy security software applications (as a CC service))

indicators.indicator: Share of enterprises that use AI technologies for ICT security
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises using AI technologies for ICT security
(Eurostat value for the variable E_AI_PITS "Enterprises use of AI technologies for ICT security")

indicators.indicator: Share of EU R&D funding to SMEs
indicators.algorithm: Share of EU R&D funding awarded to private SMEs for Horizon Europe calls related to cybersecurity = EU contribution to private SMEs for Horizon Europe calls related to cybersecurity per country in year n/EU contribution for Horizon Europe calls per country in year n per 10 units %

subareas.name: Impact of cybersecurity incidents
subareas.description: Extent to which enterpises have suffered from cybersecurity incidents.

indicators.indicator: Security Incidents: Destruction or corruption of data (All Enterprises)
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises that did not experience ICT security related incidents leading to: destruction or corruption of data (e.g. due to infection of malicious software or unauthorised intrusion, hardware or software failures)
(100 - Eurostat value for the variable E_SEC2IDCD "Enterprises experienced ICT security related incidents leading to: destruction or corruption of data (e.g. due to infection of malicious software or unauthorised intrusion, hardware or software failures)")

indicators.indicator: Security Incidents: Disclosure of confidential data (All Enterprises)
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises that did not experience ICT security related incidents leading to: disclosure of confidential data (e.g. due to intrusion, pharming, phishing attack, actions by own employees (intentionally or unintentionally))
(100 - Eurostat value for the variable E_SEC2ICNF "Enterprises experienced ICT security related incidents leading to: disclosure of confidential data (e.g. due to intrusion, pharming, phishing attack, actions by own employees (intentionally or unintentionally))")

indicators.indicator: Security Incidents: Unavailability of ICT Services (All Enterprises)
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises that did not experience ICT security related incidents leading to: unavailability of ICT services (e.g. Denial of Service attacks, ransomware attacks, hardware or software failures)
(100 -Eurostat value for the variable E_SEC2IUSV "Enterprises experienced ICT security related incidents leading to: unavailability of ICT services (e.g. Denial of Service attacks, ransomware attacks, hardware or software failures)")

subareas.name: Impact of cybersecurity incidents (SMEs)
subareas.description: Extent to which SMEs have suffered from cybersecurity incidents.

indicators.indicator: Security Incidents: Destruction or corruption of data (SME)
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises (SMEs) that did not experience ICT security related incidents leading to: destruction or corruption of data (e.g. due to infection of malicious software or unauthorised intrusion, hardware or software failures)
(100 -  Eurostat value for the variable E_SEC2IDCD "Enterprises (SMEs) experienced ICT security related incidents leading to: destruction or corruption of data (e.g. due to infection of malicious software or unauthorised intrusion, hardware or software failures)")

indicators.indicator: Security Incidents: Disclosure of confidential data (SME)
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises (SMEs) that did not experience ICT security related incidents leading to: disclosure of confidential data (e.g. due to intrusion, pharming, phishing attack, actions by own employees (intentionally or unintentionally))"

(100 - Eurostat value for the variable E_SEC2ICNF "Enterprises (SMEs) experienced ICT security related incidents leading to: disclosure of confidential data (e.g. due to intrusion, pharming, phishing attack, actions by own employees (intentionally or unintentionally)")

indicators.indicator: Security Incidents: Unavailability of ICT Services (SME)
indicators.algorithm:
Share of enterprises (SMEs)that did not experience ICT security related incidents leading to: unavailability of ICT services (e.g. Denial of Service attacks, ransomware attacks, hardware or software failures)
(100 -Eurostat value for the variable E_SEC2IUSV "Enterprises (SMEs) experienced ICT security related incidents leading to: unavailability of ICT services (e.g. Denial of Service attacks, ransomware attacks, hardware or software failures)")

areas.name: Operations
areas.description: This area describes the ability of a state to carry out operations to ensure resilience.

subareas.name: National-level response preparedness
subareas.description: Extent to which a country is prepared to deal with cyber-related issues.

indicators.indicator: Dedicated cybercrime establishment within law enforcement and prosecution offices
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (29)

*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 12 "Address cybercrime"

indicators.indicator: Incident reporting implementation
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (19)

*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 13 "Establish incident reporting mechanisms"

indicators.indicator: Threat monitoring at national level
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (12)

*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 11 "Protect critical information infrastructure"

subareas.name: National-level threat and vulnerability management
subareas.description: National effors for threat and vulnerability management.

indicators.indicator: Cyber-attack surface nationwide
indicators.algorithm:
1- average of the following variables normalised by IPs:

<U+2022> Vulnerability - Number of IPs that are exposed to at least one vulnerability
<U+2022> SSL Expired - Number of IPs with expired SSL certificate
<U+2022> SSL Old Protocol - Number of IPs with old protocols
<U+2022> SSL self-signed - Number of IPs with self-signed SSL
<U+2022> OS Linux - Number of IPs with old OS Linux
<U+2022> OS Windows - Number of IPs with old OS Windows
<U+2022> Port - Number of IPs with Ports considered that should not be publicly available on Internet (port 23,161,68,69,80,81,110,137,389,445,3389,5353)
<U+2022> Banner - Number of IPs with "authentication disabled<U+201D> banner

indicators.indicator: Vulnerability patching effectiveness
indicators.algorithm:
1 - Average normalised number of IPs exposed to the Shodan top-10 vulnerabilities:
The list of CVEs:
cve-2015-0204
cve-2015-4000
cve-2022-32548
cve-2020-0796
cve-2014-0160
cve-2015-1635
ms15-034
cve-2019-0708
cve-2021-31206
cve-2021-43798
cve-2021-40438
cve-2021-41773
cve-2021-42013
cve-2021-34473

indicators.indicator: Share of compromised IPs, services and servers
indicators.algorithm:
1 - average (normalised by number of IPs in a country) of:
- Title - Number of websites with title containing "hacked by" or <U+201D>0wn3d by<U+201D>
- Banner - Number of IPs containing "hacked by" text in published banner
- Tag - Number of Compromised IPs, command and control seervers (C2) as marked by Shodan
- Product - Number of IPs with known security offensive tools like Cobalt Strike Beacon, Posh C2, Deimos C2, Empire C2, Brute Ratel C4

indicators.indicator: Use of secure internet standards
indicators.algorithm:
average (normalised by number of IPs in a country) of:
- SSL - Number of IPs using only modern TLS protocols without potential vulnerabilities, self-signed or expired certificates
- IPv6 - Number of IPs version6 without old SSL/TLS protocols, potential vulnerabilities, self-signed or expired certificates
- Banner - Number of websites with banners publishing <U+201C>Content-Security Policy<U+201D> without old SSL/TLS protocols, potential vulnerabilities, self-signed or expired certificates

subareas.name: Operational capabilities
subareas.description: Development of joint capabilities.

indicators.indicator: Certification of CSIRT(s) in a country
indicators.algorithm: Certification = # of Certified CSIRTs/CSIRTs Under re-Certification  in a country/# of CSIRTs in a country

indicators.indicator: Presence of a country's CSIRTs in the international cybersecurity arena
indicators.algorithm: International presence of CSIRTs = #of CSIRT Teams member of FIRST in country+#of CSIRT Teams listed-accredited-certified TI/ # of CSIRTs per country - average share of CSIRTs that are either FIRST members or L/C/A or both

indicators.indicator: Participation by essential and important entities in a national or EU-level ISAC
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (2)

*Normalisation at question level: questions' score normalised to 1 point to even the weights

subareas.name: Operational cooperation
subareas.description: Definition of a framework for cooperation at the national level.

indicators.indicator: Cooperation at a national level
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx) / Maximum total score (5)

*Normalisation at question level: questions' score normalised to 1 points to even the weights

indicators.indicator: Establishment of a national reporting scheme for major cyber incidents
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (27)

*Q1 based on ES-IMC, R-GI-OE2-01 Incident taxonomy
*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 13 "Establish incident reporting mechanisms"

indicators.indicator: Establishment of operational cooperation mechanisms against cybercrime
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (34)

*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 12 "Address cybercrime"

subareas.name: Resilience of key operators
subareas.description: Resilience of key operators in terms of  incidents and their duration.

indicators.indicator: E-communications resilience (EECC) - cases<U+00A0>
indicators.algorithm:
e-communication resilience (year X) based on serious incident cases = 
            RANK (# of serious incident cases reported per 1 M citizens: high to low) / #EU MS
# of serious incident cases reported per 1 M citizens = 
             # of serious incident cases reported by country for year X / Population size (M)

indicators.indicator: E-communications resilience (EECC) <U+2013> duration<U+00A0>
indicators.algorithm:
e-communication resilience (year X) based on serious outage times = 
            RANK (SUM(serious outage times) /1 M citizens by country); high to low) / #EU MS

indicators.indicator: E-trust services resilience (e-IDAS) - cases
indicators.algorithm:
e-trust services resilience (year X) based on serious incident cases = 
            RANK (# serious of incident cases reported per 1 M citizens; high to low) / #EU MS, # of serious incident cases reported per 1 M citizens = 
             # of serious incident cases reported by country for year X / Population size (M)

indicators.indicator: E-trust services resilience (e-IDAS) - duration<U+00A0>
indicators.algorithm:
e-communication resilience (year X) based on serious outage times = 
            RANK (SUM(outage times) /1 M citizens by country); high to low) / #EU MS

indicators.indicator: Resilience of important/essential entities - cases
indicators.algorithm:
Resilience of essential and important entities (year X) based on serious incident cases = 
            RANK (# of incident cases reported per 1 M citizens: high to low) / #EU MS
# of serious incident cases reported per 1 M citizens = 
             # of serious incident cases reported by country for year X / Population size (M)

areas.name: Policy
areas.description: This area describes the state of policy development and implementation.

subareas.name: Coverage and enforcement of legal and regulatory framework
subareas.description: Existence and coverage of national legislations.

indicators.indicator: Coverage of essential sectors by national  legislation
indicators.algorithm: Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total of sectors (18)

indicators.indicator: Coverage of vulnerability disclosure policies
indicators.algorithm: Score (%) =   SUM ( Score Qx )  / Maximum total score (30)

indicators.indicator: Implementation of cybersecurity EU legislation
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM(state of eligible Directive)/TOTAL(number of eligible Directives)
    
State of eligible (cybersecurity related parts of) Directive/Regulation[i] =
- 100%  if the Directive is fully transposed (notification sent to the EC) and entered into force
- 70%  when legislation has been transposed (notification sent to the EC), but entry into effect is in the future.
- 40%  when national legislation partially covers Directive requirements, but full transposition is pending.
- 0%  otherwise

indicators.indicator: Coverage and implementation of objectives in national cybersecurity strategy
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM(Individual score per objective*) / number of pre-defined NCSS objectives (17)

* Individual score = SUM (Score for Qx**) / Maximum total score (12)
** Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels for general common questions among the objectives

subareas.name: International cooperation
subareas.description: Alignement with international practices and policies.

indicators.indicator: Alignment with the CoE Convention on Cybercrime<U+00A0>
indicators.algorithm:
Alignment = Aweight1 (40%) * Alignment CETS 185 + Aweight2 (40%) * Alignment CETS 189 + Aweight3 (20%) * Alignment CETS 224
 Alignment CETS 185 
If a country has signed AND ratified AND the convention has  entered into force date - 100%
else if a country has signed AND ratified - 80%
else if a country has signed - 15%
else 0  
Alignment CETS 189 
If a country has signed AND ratified AND the convention has  entered into force date - 100%
else if a country has signed AND ratified - 80%
else if a country has signed - 15%
else 0    Alignment CETS 224
If a country has signed AND ratified AND the convention has  entered into force date - 100%
else if a country has signed AND ratified - 80%
else if a country has signed - 15%
else 0  

Changes
The alignment to CETS 224 has been added with respect to the previous version for completeness. 
The Second Additional Protocol to the Convention on Cybercrime on enhanced co-operation and disclosure of electronic evidence (CETS No.224) provides a legal basis for disclosure of domain name registration information and for direct co-operation with service providers for subscriber information, effective means to obtain subscriber information and traffic data, immediate co-operation in emergencies, mutual assistance tools, as well as personal data protection safeguards

indicators.indicator: Establishment of international cooperation mechanisms
indicators.algorithm:
Score (%) = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score (23)

*Scoring based on adapted NCAF maturity levels, objective 17 "Engage in international cooperation (not only with EU MS)"
